intro: Bourreria orbicularis, commonly known as the globe mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its round, orbicular leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or arid environments. Its unique shape and colorful blooms make it a popular choice for xeriscaping and native plant gardens.
